A.4 DeÃ¢â¬Â¦nition of Food Groups The speciÃ¢â¬Â¦c food products purchased in each country are very dierent, in fact even the food categories used by market research Ã¢â¬Â¦rms are dierent, reÃ¢â¬Â¡ ecting dierences in the types of food purchased. We therefore classify products into 52 categories used by the USDA, making sure that each product is always classiÃ¢â¬Â¦ed in the same category whatever the country. In order to facilitate comparison across countries we further aggregate these into nine broad product categories. The category deÃ¢â¬Â¦nitions we use are given in Table A1.
